meanings.definition: In a manner relating to liturgy or public worship.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang liturgically during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The priest spoke liturgically as he led the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when the dog barked liturgically along with the hymns.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell liturgically, creating a soothing rhythm on the church roof.
meanings.sent5: The candles flickered liturgically, casting a warm glow in the sanctuary.

meanings.definition: According to the rites or forms prescribed for public worship.
meanings.sent1: The liturgically decorated altar was adorned with fresh flowers.
meanings.sent2: The liturgically correct vestments were worn by the clergy.
meanings.sent3: The liturgically arranged pews made it easy for everyone to see the pulpit.
meanings.sent4: The liturgically timed bells signaled the start of the service.
meanings.sent5: The liturgically designed stained glass windows depicted biblical scenes beautifully.
